text: Eugene Curran Kelly (August 23, 1912 â€“ February 2, 1996), better known as Gene Kelly, was an American dancer, actor, singer, director, and choreographer. He was a great example of 20th century filmed dance, famous for his energetic and athletic dancing style, his good looks and the like able characters that he played on screen. Although he is probably most famous today for his act in Singin' in the Rain, he was the most popular actor in the Hollywood musical movie industry from the mid 1940s to the early 1980s. Kelly died of a stroke on February 2, 1996. ==Other websites== * * * * The Gene Kelly Awards - University of Pittsburgh * Obituary, NY Times, February 3, 1996 * Naval Intelligence File on Gene Kelly * Gene Kelly - An American Life - PBS * Category:Academy Award Honorary Award winners Category:Actors from Pittsburgh Category:American choreographers Category:American dancers Category:American movie actors Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:Emmy Award winning directors Category:Golden Globe Award winners Category:1912 births Category:1996 deaths Category:Former Roman Catholics
title: Gene Kelly
